org.orgName: District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington

div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON.
SAM PLASTINO,-- Plaintiff, vs. HENRY M. WHITE, United States Commissioner of Immigration, at Seattle, Washington.
RECOGNIZANCE and BAIL BOND.
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA EASTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON )) SS.

We, SAM PLASTINO, of Spokane, as principal, and ANTONIO SCARPEIII, of Spokane, and JOSEPH PLASTINO, of Spokane, as sureties, jointly and severally acknowledge ourselves to be indebted unto the United States of America in the sum of $1000.00 lawful money of the United States to be levied of our goods, chattels, lands, and tenements, upon this condition, that-

WHEREAS, The said Sam Plastino has filed in the United States District Court, Western District of Washington, his petition for writ of habeas corpus, and in said cause order has been made by Honorable Jeremiah Neterer, Judge of said court, that writ of habeas corpus issue, directed to the said Henry M. White, United States Commissioner of Immigration, at Seat- tle, Washington, and that the said Sam Plastino be admitted to bail in the sum of $1000.00 pending proceedings thereon;

NOW, THEREFORE, If the said Sam Plastino shall personally be and appear before the District Court of the United states for the Western District of Washington, at the court house of the said United states, in the city of

Seattle, in the said District, at the time or times of hearing upon said petition, and from day to day, as directed by the court, and shall abide all orders of and the judgment of said court in said action or proceeding, and shall, if he be remanded to custody, surrender himself into the custody of the said Henry M. White, United States Commissioner as aforesaid, and not depart from the said district nor the said court without leave there- of, then this recognizance to be void, otherwise to remain in full force and virtue.
Sam Plastino (L.S.)
Antonio Scarpelli (L.S.)
Joseph Plastino (L.S.)
SUBSCRIBED AND SWORN TO before me by the said ANTONIO SCARPELLI and the the said Joseph Plastino this 3rd day of August, 1916.
LeRoy B. Hay Notary Public for the state of Washington, residing at Spokane, Washington.
SUBSCRIBED AND SWORN TO Before me by the said SAM PLASTINO this day of August, 1916.
Notary Public for the state of Washington, residing at Seattle, Washington.
Clay Allen Atty
Jeremiah Neterer Judge

I, ANTONIO SCARPEILI, a resident of the city of Spokane, state of Washington, do solemnly swear that after paying my just debts and lia- bilities, I am worth $40,000.00 in real estate within the Eastern District of Washington, and subject to execution, levy, and sale, as follows: Lot 8, Block 105, Third Railroad Addition to Spokane, Washington, in the city of Spokane, Spokane County, Washington: The Southeast Quarter of Section 25, Township 25, North, Range 44，E.W.M., in Spokane County, Washington.
Antonio Scarpelli
SUBSCRIBED AND SWORN TO Before me this 3rd day of August, 1916.
LeRoy B. Hay Notary Public for the state of Washington, residing at Spokane.

I, JOSEPH PLASTINO, a resident of the city of Spokane, state of Washington, do solemnly swear that after paying my just debts and liabili- ties, I am worth $40,000.00 in real estate within the Eastern District of Washington, and subject to execution, leavy, and sale, as follows: Lot 8, and the West Half of Lot 9, in Block 24, Browne's Addi- tion to Spokane Falls, Spokane County, Washington; also- Lot 1, Block 9, Resurvey & Addition to Spokane Falls, Spokane County, Washington. and over 20,000 in seasonal property
Joseph Plastino
SUBSCRIBED AND SWORN TO Before me this 3rd day of August, 1916.
LeRoy B. Hay Notary Public for the state of Washington, residing at Spokane.

The said sureties herein, each for himself and not one for the other, does further swear that he is a married man; that he is possessed of separate estate within the state of Washington over $5000.00 other than community estate, over and above all debts and liabilities subject to, and not for any reason in law exempt from execution.
Antonio Scarpelli
Joseph Plastino
SUBSCRIBED AND SWORN To Before me this 3rd day of August, 1916.
LeRoy B Hay Notary Public for the state of Washington, residing at Spokane, Washington.
CERTIFICATE OF SOLVENCY

I CERTIFY That I have made due and diligent personal inquiry as to the financial responsibility of the signers of the foregoing bond, and am satisfied that their representations as to their financial resources are true in every respect,except in my opinion all of Joseph Plastino's property in community property and that they are good and sufficient, and fully responsible to insure the payment of the entire amount named in the bond. WITNESSMy hand and seal this 3rd day of August, 1916.
Francis A. Garrecht (L.S.) United States District Attorney for the Eastern District of Washington.
No.
IN THE District COURT OF THE In and for W. Dist of Washington
Sam Plastino Plaintiff vs. Henry M. White Comm. Im. Defendant.
Recognizance W. Habeas Corpus
Service for the within accepted and receipt of copy acknowledged this day of 191 Attorney for
TOLMAN & KING ATTORNEYS AT LAW 1112 OLD NATIONAL BANK BLDG. SPOKANE, WASHINGTON
FILED IN THE U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION AUG 3 1916 FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By Edm Laken Deputy 2x
